findings.title: Ensure rotation for customer created CMKs is enabled.
findings.description:
CIS Benchmark: **3.8**

Ensure rotation for customer created CMKs is enabled.

Rotating encryption keys helps reduce the potential impact of a compromised key as data encrypted with a new key cannot be accessed with a previous key that may have been exposed.

## Remediation

Refer to the provider documentation for the configuration options available.

## Documentation

- [AWS Terraform](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs)
- [Azure Terraform](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs)
- [Google Cloud Terraform](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs)

details.name: Ensure rotation for customer created CMKs is enabled.

findings.title: Ensure the S3 bucket has access logging enabled.
findings.description:
CIS Benchmark: **3.11**

Ensure that Object-level logging for read/write events is enabled for S3 bucket.

Enabling object-level logging will help you meet data compliance requirements within your organization, perform comprehensive security analysis, monitor specific patterns of user behavior in your AWS account or take immediate actions on any object-level API activity using Amazon CloudWatch Events.

## Remediation

Refer to the provider documentation for the configuration options available.

details.name: Ensure S3 bucket has MFA delete enabled.

findings.title: Ensure all data stored in the S3 bucket is securely encrypted at rest.
findings.description:
CIS Benchmark: **2.1.1**

Ensure all S3 buckets employ encryption-at-rest.

Encrypting data at rest reduces the likelihood that it is unintentionally exposed and can nullify the impact of disclosure if the encryption remains unbroken.

## Remediation

Refer to the provider documentation for the configuration options available.

details.name: Ensure all data stored in the S3 bucket is securely encrypted at rest.

findings.title: Ensure the S3 bucket has access logging enabled.
findings.description:
CIS Benchmark: **3.11**

Ensure that Object-level logging for read/write events is enabled for S3 bucket.

Enabling object-level logging will help you meet data compliance requirements within your organization, perform comprehensive security analysis, monitor specific patterns of user behavior in your AWS account or take immediate actions on any object-level API activity using Amazon CloudWatch Events.

## Remediation

Refer to the provider documentation for the configuration options available.

findings.title: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0:0 to port 22.
findings.description:
CIS Benchmark: **5.2**

Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports.

Public access to remote server administration ports, such as 22 and 3389, increases resource attack surface and unnecessarily raises the risk of resource compromise.

## Remediation

Refer to the provider documentation for the configuration options available.

- [Google Cloud Terraform](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs)
